meanings.sent1: She outblushed all her friends when she received a compliment.
meanings.sent2: The shy girl outblushed everyone in the room when she was praised.
meanings.sent3: The little boy outblushed his sister, making her giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks outblushed the roses in the garden.
meanings.sent5: His embarrassment outblushed the setting sun.

meanings.definition: To cause to blush more intensely than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Her teasing remarks outblushed him, turning his face red.
meanings.sent2: The embarrassing joke outblushed the recipient, making them blush deeply.
meanings.sent3: The playful banter outblushed the serious conversation, adding a touch of humor.
meanings.sent4: His unexpected compliment outblushed her, leaving her speechless.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected question outblushed her, catching her off guard.
